00013 <?
00014 /**
00015  *      PHP-MIDDLEWARE INTERACTION
00016  *
00017  *      This php script runs in the local machine as user 'apache', is the 'father' process. 
00018  *      In a remote machine (our grid User Interface) we open a 'child' process, and it's runs as  
00019  *      the user validated before. That user must connect via ssh to the User Interface without password
00020  *      See http://www.cs.umd.edu/~arun/misc/ssh.html and http://www.openssh.com/
00021  *      Remember that the User Interface has mounted a directory in the local machine
00022  *      
00023  *      DOCKING PROGRAM
00024  *
00025  *      Gramm - Global Range Molecular Matching
00026  *
00027  *      Protein-Protein Docking and Protein-Ligand Docking
00028  *      {@link http://reco3.ams.sunysb.edu/gramm/ Home site}
00029  *
00030  *      @package GridGRAMM
00031  *      @author David Garcia Aristegui <david@cnb.uam.es>
00032  *      @copyright CSIC - GPL
00033  *      @version 1.0    
00034  */
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * General utility functions
00038  */
00039 require("./functions.php");
00040 
00041 
00042 // MANAGING GRAMM AND GRID MIDDLEWARE REQUIRED FILES
00043 // *************************************************
00044 
00045 // Step One
00046 // Directory in the local machine 
00047 create_working_directory($grid_path);
00048 
00049 // Step Two
00050 // We  put with the user form the Receptor and Ligand files in the gramm directory inside the w.d.
00051 upload_user_data($grid_path, $random_value);
00052 
00053 // Step Three
00054 // We generate in the gramm directory inside the w.d.the three gr files requiered to run gramm: 
00055 // rmol.gr, rpar.gr and wlist.gr; the resolution determine the rpar.gr 
00056 /**
00057  * Resolution to use (HR or LR)
00058  *
00059  * @global string $resolution
00060  */
00061 $resolution=$_POST["resolution"];
00062 
00063 create_gr_files($grid_path, $random_value, $resolution);
00064 
00065 // Step Four
00066 // We put requiered files in the gramm directory inside the w.d., the .dat files, the gramm executable file and
00067 // a small shell script to run gramm with the requiered environment variable and parameters...
00068 install_gramm($grid_path, $random_value);
00069 
00070 // Step five
00071 // We generate the JDL file,required to send the job with gramm over the EGEE testebed
00072 create_jdl_file($grid_path, $random_value);
00073 
00074 // Step Six
00075 // We go to the gramm directory, inside the w.d.
00076 
00077 //XXX
00078 chdir("$grid_path/$random_value/gramm");
00079 
00080 // Step seven
00081 // We compress all the gramm files: gramm executable, .dat files, the uploaded receptor and ligand and the .gr files.
00082 exec("tar -cf gramm-go.tar gramm *.dat *.pdb *gr; gzip gramm-go.tar");
00083 
00084 //*************************************************
00085 //*************************************************
00086 
00087 if( file_exists("$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/file.jdl") )
00088 {       
00089         // 'Child' process
00090         open_connection($server, $grid_path, $process, $descriptorspec, $pipes);
00091 
00092         // Enter the Grid!!!
00093         //enter_grid($pipes, $grid_pass);
00094         
00095         // We submit the gramm job over the grid
00096         //fwrite($pipes[0], "edg-job-submit -o $grid_path/$random_value/gramm/identifier.txt $grid_path/$random_value/gramm/file.jdl > $grid_path/$random_value/gramm/submit.txt\n");
00097 } else
00098 {
00099         "<h1>Error, there is no JDL file!!!</h1><br /></body></html>\n";
00100         exit;
00101 }
00102 
00103 //fwrite($pipes[0], "grid-proxy-destroy\n");
00104 
00105 close_connection($process, $descriptorspec, $pipes);
00106 
00107 // display background running notice
00108 echo "<center><h1>Your Gramm job has been started.</h1></center>";
00109 echo "<center><h2>Please don't reload this page.</h2><br />";
